Adventure.Core
Class Engine

java.lang.Object
  Adventure.Core.Engine

public class Engine
extends java.lang.Object

The Engine class is the foundation of the Adventure.Core package. It is responsible for setting up the game, gathering user input, and making sure applying game rules.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Firmy

Field Summary
private static java.util.Scanner scanner
          This field is used to hold a Scanner object that will retrieve all user inputs.
 
Constructor Summary
private Engine()
          This constructor is Private so there can not be an instance of the Engine class.
 
Method Summary
static void applyRules()
          This method will loop through all GameRuleSets for the Level and call their applyRules() methods.
static void endGame(java.lang.String endingText)
          This method will cause the game to end, outputting whatever text is passed in to it before ending in an infinite loop, which forces the user to close the console window.
static void getInput()
          This method is used to get user input from the keyboard and to send it to the Processor to be processed.
static java.lang.String getUnprocessedInput()
          This method is used to get user input, but instead of sending it to the Processor, the input is returned to the caller.
static void showTitleScreen()
          This method will display the game Title Screen to the player when the game is first loaded.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Field Detail

scanner

private static java.util.Scanner scanner
This field is used to hold a Scanner object that will retrieve all user inputs.

Constructor Detail

Engine

private Engine()
This constructor is Private so there can not be an instance of the Engine class. All of the methods of this class are static.

Method Detail

getInput

public static void getInput()
This method is used to get user input from the keyboard and to send it to the Processor to be processed.

getUnprocessedInput

public static java.lang.String getUnprocessedInput()
This method is used to get user input, but instead of sending it to the Processor, the input is returned to the caller.

Returns:
The String of user input.

showTitleScreen

public static void showTitleScreen()
This method will display the game Title Screen to the player when the game is first loaded. It will then wait for the user to press the Enter key before continuing.

endGame

public static void endGame(java.lang.String endingText)
This method will cause the game to end, outputting whatever text is passed in to it before ending in an infinite loop, which forces the user to close the console window. This ensures that a user can't accidently close the window before having the chance to read the ending text.

Parameters:
endingText - The text to display as the game ending.

applyRules

public static void applyRules()
This method will loop through all GameRuleSets for the Level and call their applyRules() methods. It is called every game turn.
